Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Pulsatile vs Nonpulsatile Cardiopulmonary Bypass in Pediatric Congenital Heart Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 159 pediatric patients (<18 years) scheduled for cardiac surgery at Penn State Health Children's Hospital were randomised

Participants.evidence: 159 pediatric patients (<18 years) scheduled for cardiac surgery at Penn State Health Children's Hospital

Intervention.evidence: randomised to pulsatile (n=83) or nonpulsatile (n=76) CPB

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the effects of pulsatile versus nonpulsatile cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) on cerebral hemodynamics and clinical outcomes in pediatric patients with congenital heart disease (CHD)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was organ injury, measured by the Pediatric Logistic Organ Dysfunction-2 (PELOD-2) score at 24, 48, and 72 hours postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applied to outcome assessors, patients, or clinicians

Number_Randomised.evidence: randomised to pulsatile (n=83) or nonpulsatile (n=76) CPB

Result_Outcome.evidence: The pulsatility index was significantly higher in the pulsatile group (p<0.05), but no significant differences were observed in regional cerebral oxygen saturation, mean arterial pressure, or gaseous microemboli counts
